title: What does a Javascript Notebook Look Like?

cells.content:
# Cell types ## Markdown cell This is a markdown cell, just as you would see in Jupyter or R-markdown. It supports all the normal markdown things you'd expect including inline ### Demo of targeting elements within a markdown cell Below this paragraph is a div with id="targetDiv":
We'll target that div with a small THREE.js example, which we'll run in cells below. ## JS cell The following cell is a Javascript cell
cells.value:
Cell types

Markdown cell

This is a markdown cell, just as you would see in Jupyter or R-markdown. It supports all the normal markdown things you'd expect including inline

Demo of targeting elements within a markdown cell

Below this paragraph is a div with id="targetDiv":

We'll target that div with a small THREE.js example, which we'll run in cells below.

JS cell

The following cell is a Javascript cell

cells.content:
### External script cells
the cell below is an "external script cell". It loads external JS from URLs.
